R.AV TRUE COPY!/

PATO JUDGE

SUNIL THOMAS, J. OE!
Crl.M.C.No.3949 of 2016
Dated this the 3 day of January, 2017
ORDER

The petitioner herein is the 6" accused in CC.No.96
of 2016 on the file of Judicial First Class Magistrate Court-
I, Kozhikode for the offences punishable under Sections
143, 147, 341, 323, 332, 427 read with 149 of the Indian
Penal Code.

2. The crux on the prosecution allegation is that a
team of shadow police was on their duty at 10 pm on
22.05.2015. They intercepted a group of six persons who
were drinking in a public place. When they were asked to
move out of the place, they questioned the shadow police
and even after revealing the identity, they insisted for,
seeing their identity cards. Thereafter they were
challenged, abused and beaten on the various parts of
the body. Crime was registered thereafter. In the
meanwhile it is further stated that keys of the their
vehicles were also taken away by the group. They were
saved by the police who had reached the spot after

2017/KER/52
Crl.M.C.No.3949 of 2016 2
receiving the information. After investigation final report
was laid.

3. The specific contention of the petitioner is that
even as per the police records, he reached the spot later
and he has been wrongly implicated. The available
records do not support that stand. Since specific overtacts
are attributed to the petitioner herein also. Having regard
to this fact, I feel that it is a matter to be agitated before
the court below. I am not inclined to consider this Crl.M.C
at this stage. It is dismissed reserving the right of the
petitioner herein to move for discharge if so advised.

Crl.M.C is dismissed.

Sd/-
SUNIL THOMAS, JUDGE
RAV ITTRUE COPY/I
PATO JUDGE
